CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 23, 1954, pg. 6 reads:"Cadillac Bandit - Herman Blackman of 15 Perry Street, who on Tuesday confessed to the theft of thirteen Cadillacs and numerous other charges of larceny and armed robbery, is led from the courtroom by Deputy Sheriff Archie Barnett shortly after he testified against Landrew Smith, whom Blackman said was the chauffeur in an October hold-up of the J.J. Morris and Son Company, McCandless and Harrison Streets. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Deputy Sheriff Archie Barnett, left, escorting Herman Blackman from courtroom in Allegheny County Courthouse
